titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Crawford F. Sams papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Helena Ong

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-05-26T09:44-0700

change.item: Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Jill Golden.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Crawford F. Sams Papers)//EN" "sams.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 15 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 11 envelopes, 1 oversize folder

did.abstract: The Crawford F. Sams papers contain correspondence, orders, speeches and writings, research data, printed matter, certificates, and photographs relating to American military medical activities in the Middle East during World War II, American military medical activities in the Korean War, Allied public health activities in occupied Japan, and scientific research on the effects of radiation.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Crawford F. Sams papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1979.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Enlisted as private in 159th Infantry, California National Guard
Army Medical Postgraduate School, Walter Reed

eventgrp.event: Graduated, Field Artillery School at Fort Sill
B.S. Psychology, University of California Berkeley

chronitem.event: M.S. Neurology, Washington University of St. Louis

eventgrp.event: M.D., Washington University of St. Louis

chronitem.event: Instructor, Medical Field Service, Carlisle, Pennsylvania
Director of department, Medical Field Service, Carlisle
Assistant department surgeon, Department of U.S. Army, Panama Canal
Medical instructor, Infantry School, Fort Benning, Columbus, Georgia
Chief surgeon, United States Army Forces in the Middle East (USAFIME), Cairo, Egypt
Chief of Research and Development, War Department General Staff, Washington D.C.
Chief of Public Health and Welfare Section of the General Headquarters, Supreme Command Allied Powers, U.S. Army, Japan
Chief of Public Health and Welfare Section, General Headquarters, Supreme Commander Allied Power for Japan, Tokyo, Japan
Member, Special Board for the Army Surgeon General

eventgrp.event: Research physician, University of California Berkeley Operations Research Center and University of California San Francisco Department of Neurology

chronitem.event: Research physician and professor, University of California Berkeley
Medical director, Institute of Medical Physics, University of California Berkeley

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Crawford F. Sams papers contain correspondence, orders, speeches and writings, research data, printed matter, certificates, and photographs relating to American military medical activities in the Middle East during World War II, American military medical activities in the Korean War, Allied public health activities in occupied Japan, and scientific research on the effects of radiation.
Original folder titles and arrangement were maintained. Unless otherwise noted, Sams is the author of writings within the collection. Materials in boxes 9 to 15 relate to Sams' radiation research.

did.unittitle: "The Impact of Hiroshima and Nagasaki on Military Medical Operations,"
"The Contribution of General Crawford F. Sams to the Occupation of Japan, 1945-1951," Ann Crusa Wyman, M.A. thesis,
Printed matter and clippings relating to Brookhaven National Laboratory,
Printed matter and clippings on public health activities in Japan,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A section of a U.S. Army Medical Service history of medical activities in World War II.

did.unittitle: "Are We Using All Our Weapons Against Tuberculosis?," Albert and Mary Lasker Foundation,
Address given at the dedication program,
Requests for reprints, "Experiences in Immunization Against TB with BCG Vaccines in Japan,"
"Views and Recommendations Concerning Military and Civilian Planning in Time of Total War,"
Public Health and Welfare in Japan,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series of printed reports issued by Public Health and Welfare Section, General Headquarters, Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers.

619 prints of people, street scenes, and military and medical scenes in occupied Japan after World War II,
